body.p:
Morganfield Union County Kentucky
February the 7th 1862
Govenor Magoffin

I was shown a petition addressed to your Excelency praying the repreave of Vincent Shields a Convict in the Kentucky penitentiary from this county convicted under a charge of killing his wife -- the petition Sets forth the substance of the evidence given on the trial. I was requested to sign said petition, which I could not do, Because I did not heare the trial & of couse could not certify what was the testimony On the trial -- though I have no doubt it is Correctly set forth, by the draftsman of the same who would not make a statement to deceive any person, & I know he was present & heard every thing that was deposed -- I will say this in behalf of Shields petition, after his trial & conviction, I heard a general public opinion expressed, that the testimony did not warrant the Conviction, I think a Majority of persons who talked about the case so expressed themsleves.

Shields Stood fare in this Community before this occurance happened, he is connected with a clever family in this County & Spencer, he is an old man & cannot live out his time in the Penitentiary -- and I believe his case is worthy of executive Clemency. Yours respectfully
